summary: Email correspondence between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) regarding arrangements to review and scan documents from the prior SDFL investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators, which are stored in the West Palm Beach office. The SDNY team is prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell and seeks access to these materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of prosecution by the SDNY team mentioned in the email. The SDNY is seeking documents related to the prior SDFL investigation into Epstein and his co-conspirators for their case against her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The prior SDFL investigation was into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators. Documents from this investigation are stored in West Palm Beach and are sought by the SDNY for the Maxwell prosecution.

connections.description: The document references the prior SDFL investigation into 'Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators,' and the SDNY is prosecuting Maxwell, implying their alleged conspiratorial relationship.

events.title: SDNY request for SDFL Epstein documents
events.description: The Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at SDNY emails the SDFL to request arrangements to review and scan documents from the prior SDFL investigation into Epstein, for use in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Follow-up on document access
events.description: A Managing Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach responds, confirming the materials are in a secure room and detailing previous scanning arrangements made for an OPR inquiry, offering to coordinate access for the SDNY.

locations: West Palm Beach Regional Office â€” SDFL
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) is actively prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell and seeks evidence from a prior Southern District of Florida (SDFL) investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
Physical boxes of case files and documents from the SDFL Epstein investigation are stored in a secure room in the West Palm Beach office.
An Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) inquiry had previously accessed and scanned some of these materials, indicating prior internal reviews of the Epstein case files.
The correspondence shows inter-district coordination between federal prosecutors to share investigative materials for an ongoing prosecution.
